Elderly.

While people of all ages can enjoy walking, the elderly tend to have more time and mobility to engage in regular walking activities. As people age, their metabolism slows down, and their bodies may require more exercise to maintain their physical health. Walking is an excellent way for the elderly to stay active, improve their cardiovascular health, and reduce the risk of chronic diseases such as heart disease and diabetes. Additionally, walking can help elderly individuals maintain their independence and social connections, which is crucial for their overall well-being.
